channel.title: Windows XP Versus Vista
channel.description:
Well i am planning on buying a laptop an i was wondering if its worth it to get vista or xp? There is a fairly good laptop that has these
[code]ACER aspire laptop with 3GB memory and 320GB hard drive. Intel centrino Processor Technology. Intel Next-Gen Wirless N+a/b/g. Burns and plays CDs and DVDs. Built-in Webcam. Intergrated fingerprint reader. Windows Vista Home Premium service pack 1[/code]
is this a good laptop to buy?

item.title: Windows XP Versus Vista
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Out of XP and vista, I would pick XP every time, but if I had the choice of any OS, I would have a linux distro. Either SuSe or ubuntu.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Versus Vista
item.dc:creator: @Uriko Uriko
item.description:
@Uriko wrote:

Go with Vista. Just disable UAC and you’re fine. SP1 fixed any bugs I had with it before hand.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Versus Vista

Who are you to answer for God?

item.title: Windows XP Versus Vista
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:16, topic:205395”][quote author=happy_world link=topic=271071.msg2224545#msg2224545 date=1210763899]
hey i had a friend who buyed vista laptop when he upgraded to xp everything work fine except he had a shorter battery life e.g. battery life is for 3 hours when he upgraded it came down to 2 hours. and i and few of my friends done some research and found with laptops when you upgrade it, it battery life gets short. and if u reformat it and comes back to the operating system that came with it; it battery life would be the same as the company mentioned.

we tried to find from where is this problem arising from but we came back we few different answer. so we left it to the company to do there own research and hopefully in the future they can make a laptop works on whatever operating system on the same battery life.
[/quote]

You made God cry.[/quote]
God does not cry and why do you need to get God is this anyway

Read full topic

we tried to find from where is this problem arising from but we came back we few different answer. so we left it to the company to do there own research and hopefully in the future they can make a laptop works on whatever operating system on the same battery life.[/quote]

item.title: Windows XP Versus Vista
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:14, topic:205395”][quote author=Cruzer link=topic=271071.msg2223944#msg2223944 date=1210729830]

Upgrade it to xp. (Yes, vista to xp is an upgrade).

you’ve probably never used vista before, yet another bandwagon.

I have vista (triboot) and its not good at all, the only thing I could say thats good about is DX10.

The laptop is actually pretty good.
[/quote]
right but ninja probably hasn’t, if you have then its fine if you say shit, if you havent dont bandwagon[/quote]

I’ve tried it - it is shit

Even Microsoft believe it sucks, and that is bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Windows XP Versus Vista
item.dc:creator: @happy_world happy_world
item.description:
@happy_world wrote:

hey i had a friend who buyed vista laptop when he upgraded to xp everything work fine except he had a shorter battery life e.g. battery life is for 3 hours when he upgraded it came down to 2 hours. and i and few of my friends done some research and found with laptops when you upgrade it, it battery life gets short. and if u reformat it and comes back to the operating system that came with it; it battery life would be the same as the company mentioned.

we tried to find from where is this problem arising from but we came back we few different answer. so we left it to the company to do there own research and hopefully in the future they can make a laptop works on whatever operating system on the same battery life.

Read full topic

In terms of hardware, that’s got pretty decent specs for a notebook.
